lom:description.lom:string:
"AOSS studies cover a range of disciplines that answer the demand for scientists and engineers with a broad knowledge of the many earth-ocean-atmosphere system processes.
AOSS programs focus on the description and explanation of phenomena in the atmosphere and oceans of the Earth; the exploration of planets and other solar system bodies; and the study of the heliosphere (the sphere of influence of the Sun) as a single system.
AOSS students have an extensive background in atmospheric and space science and in the engineering of complex and highly reliable space systems and instrumentation because of the integrated nature of the program.
As an AOSS graduate student you will be working with and learning from men and women who are among the world leaders in many areas of atmospheric and space sciences Ã¢?? as it has been for more than five decades."

lom:title.lom:string: Graduate Atmospheric, Oceanic and Space Sciences Curriculum - University of Michigan
